Author: mv#8810
Content: If we prefer a world of decentralized swaps, then in the long run we do want to be able to handle 50 BTC swaps.  If I'm a car dealer, I want to be able to accept payment in, say, Verge, and deliver the car the same day.  That probably means I have to be able to swap the payment into whatever funds are accepted by the factor who has loaned the money to buy my inventory.

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: exactly. now, couple that with the fact that Bitcoin was never supposed to have fees for most use cases and only fees for large data transactions

Content: No

Content: seems excessively high

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: understood

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
1) stop thinking of BTC fees in pseudo USD
2) blame Core devs, they created the estimatefee algorithm

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: HyperDEX seeds are compatible with Agama, so you could import it and send from there to get around it for now

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Okay but point being fees are higher than necessary regardless of semantics

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: @lukechilds thanks I can try that. Just trying to create UTXOs so I can get a swap to go through

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: Again, that's something you need to take up with the coin devs (Core created this by design)

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Ok but why is Agama able to estimate fees that are much lower?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
Agama uses a flat fee and marketmaker uses a live fee to speed trades
different tools, different functions, different needs

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
When you send BTC as a currency, it matters less if it sits a block or 3.
When you trade BTC as a commodity, no one wants to wait an hr for a trade to complete.

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Doing a manual withdrawal needs to use speed trading why?

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: I understand the need for speed when trading within hyperdex but I am just trying to create UTXOs I have no issue waiting 5-10 minutes

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: It's key to understand that DEX isn't meant to be a wallet, and there are no "withdraws"

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Not going to pretend to be smart enough to understand the complexities of all of this but it seems like we are blaming core devs while we are using the wrong tool for the job

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
The point is to allow you to use funds from your private wallet to freely trade for some other CoinX
Use your wallet for wallet things and DEX for trade things and you'll be golden

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Not trying to be combative here

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: But creating UTXOs is something unique and new to me

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: When I have to mess around sending stuff back and forth to try and get a swap to go through I dont want to be paying excessive fees

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: I didnt think to try and use Agama to send to myself though so that is a way I can try that to bypass the fees

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: In the name of user friendly experience it seems like it would be possible to give them the option of using a lower fee if time is not important for a manual withdrawal

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
"it seems like we are blaming core devs while we are using the wrong tool for the job"
No, I'm placing "blame" estimate fee code on Core, because they wrote it. You asked why the fee is "high" and I responded specifically as to the difference.
Any wallet tools in DEX are meant for convenience and most coins don't suffer such an issue because their devs didn't code it to economically scale profits for miners.

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Ok I accept your answer as being truthful as well, just wondering if it cannot be better

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
"In the name of user friendly experience it seems like it would be possible to give them the option of using a lower fee if time is not important for a manual withdrawal"
The short truth is that marketmaker uses the same code for both; however, I'm sure that devs would welcome anyone writing a separate, low-fee routine for manual transfers...

Author: TomiDCat#6017
Content: Ya I think that was the answer I was looking for

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not using the "txfee" field and letting m use the BTC stupidestimatefee api, well it is what it is
